meanings.definition: The manner in which sounds or musical notes are produced or heard.
meanings.sent1: The voicings of the birds in the forest created a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent2: The choir director carefully selected the voicings for the upcoming performance.
meanings.sent3: The voicings of the wind seemed to be singing along with the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent4: The voicings of the instruments blended together like a harmonious symphony.
meanings.sent5: Her unique voicings added depth and emotion to the music.

meanings.definition: The arrangement or combination of voices or instruments in a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The voicings of the choir members complemented each other perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The jazz band experimented with different voicings to find the right balance.
meanings.sent3: The voicings of the instruments seemed to be having a conversation on stage.
meanings.sent4: The voicings of the orchestra painted a vivid picture of a bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The voicings of the singers intertwined to create a mesmerizing harmony.

meanings.definition: The act of giving voice to something.
meanings.sent1: Her voicings of the characters in the play brought the story to life.
meanings.sent2: The politician's voicings on the issue resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The voicings of the cartoon characters made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: His voicings of the animals in the storybook were so realistic.
meanings.sent5: The voicings of the actors conveyed the emotions of the scene effectively.
